posts.name: Liran
posts.cooked:
Last week we got a second hand limelight 2+ from another team (I saw the limelight working there)

Today we tried connecting to it, and I went over all the steps carefully from this video ,and I also saw the official docs I downloaded the latest image for the limelight from the official docs and managed to image it correctly and got it up and running .then, I connected it via a poe image 1599×899 153 KB

image 1599×899 153 KB

image 1599×899 153 KB

I tried looking for it using the limelight finder and got nothing bedsides these logs that show that it is broadcasting and listening on 10.68.212.62:5809 I also tried http://limelight.local:5801/ but nothing showed up also. image 825×599 16 KB

image 825×599 16 KB

image 825×599 16 KB

I tried using wireshark to see the packages that were running on my connection but there wasn’t any important stuff over there.

I tried using angry ip scanner to see if I can find the limelight but besides getting known ips for stuff like the RoboRio it didn’t got far their too.

I tried connecting the limelight router directly to my pc and cut off the RoboRio from the mix but I still wasn’t able the connect to any ip.

I tried switching to another laptop (linux computer) and tried the same steps to no avail.

I’ve reset the limelight a couple of times during the debugging session I also used a couple of cables and imaged it twice.

Anyone have any thoughts on the situation?

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
I’m no networking expert so I’d try to figure out why Guido handed out a 10.68.212.62 instead of 10.19.43.211 which I presume came from the LL that you entered your team number 19 43. If you don’t figure this out before an expert has the answer you might give us more information such as did you assign the team number to LL and did you assign a static IP to the LL and what’s the team number that the radio is configured at and what is the range in the radio for static and dynamic IP addresses.

edit also it appears you have reversed the recommended use of the radio ports for the roboRIO and the LL .

posts.name: Liran
posts.cooked:
Is there a way to set up the limelight’s ip before entering the configuration panel?

I just tried changing to router’s IP address to be as the team that we got it from, still no luck with that.

also about the ethernet cables being reversed, during the debug session we swapped their locations to see if something changed and didn’t return it after… it was my bad

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
If you still have your problem with the LL and nobody else has instantly recognized what’s wrong then I can give some general advice on what I’d do. Do everything over again being very careful to check your work at every step of the way.

First, reimage the LL (yes, I know, again) making sure you have the correct version for your LL model. Make sure the Etcher is the latest version and you have the latest device driver installed on your PC. Everyone swears they do all this right so it’s surprising how many skipped a step or two or didn’t use the right versions.

Second, similarly for the robot radio, reimage it and verify everything is right and use your team number.

Connect your PC Wi-Fi to the radio exactly as you normally do to drive the robot.

Connect the LL to the radio.

You don’t need a roboRIO connected to the radio at this point.

You should be able to access the LL from your PC with the nice name http://limelight.local:5801/

Then assign your static IP on the LL dashboard (some people say this is essentially required and some people say this shouldn’t be done unless you prove it won’t work with a dynamic address).

posts.name: Liran
posts.cooked:
Thank you for your response.

I managed to fix the issue. Apparently I got it right before (by changing the IP of the router to the other team).

Today when I got back to the workshop I restarted the limelight finder software with the other team’s router IP and the server got up and running

Thank help for your help
